talk.author: did:plc:r2d6qfd2tib7qrk2bmic3owe
talk.utter: Does that mean you’ll stop companies like Hugging Face from hosting the data from Firehose? We need something in place to make sure data is used responsibly by everyone, not just by Bluesky please.

talk.author: did:plc:kf7kejzn4dpqczmp6jd3uci6
talk.utter:
They can't. The whole point of the protocol is to be open. That's what makes it so anyone can make a third-party app.

Unfortunately, the same way that a third-party app can read posts - so can any bot. And there's no API keys involved, so no way to restrict access.

It's a double-edged sword.

talk.author: did:plc:r2d6qfd2tib7qrk2bmic3owe
talk.utter: Well hopefully they figure out a way. Legal or not, it’s abhorrent.
